content.content:
Formatting of this note is different from the original.
GEORGE WASHINGTON SCHOOL OF MEDICINE & HEALTH SCIENCES
DIVISION OF GENERAL INTERNAL MEDICINE
Chief Complaint: Blood in Urine and Difficulty Urinating
Problem List[1]
Medications:
Medications Prior to Visit[2]
Allergies:
He has no known allergies.
Subjective:
HPI: Kenneth Maurice Gross is a 56 y.o. male who is here for blood in urine for 2 days. Had urge urination at night , stream was poor & then had red blood in urine for the day intermittantly. Since then drinking lots of water & urine cleared up. Some pain in back. No fever
I have reviewed the past medical, past surgical, family and social history.
Review of Systems
Constitutional: Negative for fatigue and fever.
Respiratory: Negative for cough and shortness of breath.
Cardiovascular: Negative for chest pain and palpitations.
Gastrointestinal: Negative for abdominal distention and blood in stool.
Genitourinary: Positive for dysuria, flank pain and urgency.
Objective:
Visit Vitals
BP 105/68 (BP Location: Left arm, Patient Position: Sitting, BP Cuff Size: Large adult)
Pulse 61
Temp 36.8 °C (98.2 °F) (Oral)
Ht 5' 7" (1.702 m)
Wt 172 lb (78 kg)
BMI 26.94 kg/m²
Smoking Status Never
BSA 1.92 m²
Body mass index is 26.94 kg/m².
Physical Exam
Constitutional:
General: He is not in acute distress.
Appearance: He is not ill-appearing.
Cardiovascular:
Rate and Rhythm: Normal rate and regular rhythm.
Pulmonary:
Effort: Pulmonary effort is normal.
Breath sounds: Normal breath sounds.
Abdominal:
General: Abdomen is flat. There is no distension.
Lab or Diagnostic Testing:
Results for orders placed or performed in visit on 07/16/25
POCT Urinalysis dipstick
Collection Time: 07/16/25 8:15 AM
Result Value Ref Range
COLOR, URINE (Relaymed) Straw
CLARITY, URINE (Relaymed) Hazy
GLUCOSE, URINE (Relaymed) Negative
BILIRUBIN, URINE, POCT (Relaymed) Negative
KETONES, URINE (Relaymed) Negative
SPECIFIC GRAVITY, URINE (Relaymed) 1.015 1.003 - 1.030
HEMOGLOBIN, URINE, POCT (Relaymed) Positive
PH, URINE (Relaymed) 6.0 5.0 - 9.0
PROTEIN,TOTAL, URINE, BY DIPSTICK ASSAY (Relaymed) Moderate
UROBILINOGEN, URINE, BY DIPSTICK (Relaymed) 2.0
LEUKOCYTE ESTERASE, URINE, POCT (Relaymed) Negative
NITRITE, URINE (Relaymed) Negative
Appearance, Fluid Hazy
Assessment & Plan:
New onset Hematuria ? Kidney stones. Referred to urology & ordered Us renal. Pt knows to go to ED if severe discomfort or obvious hematuria returns. Continue xarelto for now
DVT, PE diagnosed 2024 on life long anticoagulation with xarelto
Zareen Zaidi, MD PhD
Professor of Medicine
Division of General Internal Medicine
George Washington School of Medicine & Health Sciences
Office 202-741-3000
zzaidi@mfa.gwu.edu
[1]
Patient Active Problem List
Diagnosis
Encounter for health maintenance examination
Left shoulder pain
Stage 2 chronic kidney disease
Acute pulmonary embolism without acute cor pulmonale (CMS-HCC)
Deep vein thrombosis (DVT) of distal vein of left lower extremity (CMS-HCC)
Protein S deficiency (CMS/HCC)
[2]
Outpatient Medications Prior to Visit
Medication Sig Dispense Refill
Multiple Vitamins-Minerals (GNP Mega Multi for Men) tablet Take 1 Package by mouth daily. 3
rivaroxaban (Xarelto) 20 MG tablet Take 1 tablet (20 mg) by mouth with evening meal. Take with food. 90 tablet 0
Zinc-Magnesium Aspart-Vit B6 (ZINC MAGNESIUM ASPARTATE PO) Take by mouth.
Na Sulfate-K Sulfate-Mg Sulf (Suprep Bowel Prep Kit) 17.5-3.13-1.6 GM/177ML solution Please provide the patient with one kit. Take as instructed (Patient not taking: Reported on 7/10/2025) 354 mL 0
saccharomyces boulardii (Florastor) 250 MG capsule Take 1 capsule (250 mg) by mouth two (2) times daily. (Patient not taking: Reported on 7/10/2025) 180 capsule 3
No facility-administered medications prior to visit.
Electronically signed by Zaidi, Zareen at 07/16/2025 8:23 AM EDT
